p: According to the ceRNA hypothesis, lncRNAs act as an “miRNA sponge” to moderate miRNA expression and consequently affect mRNA level, forming networks of “lncRNA–miRNA–mRNA” interactions and regulating downstream pathways. Recently, Liu et al. (2019) knocked down lncRNA H19, and they found that cell proliferation and invasion in the ectopic endometrium is inhibited through miR-124-3p targeted suppression of the ITGB3. Therefore, we deduced that it is possible there are several lncRNAs in endothelial cells could regulate the “miR-124-3p/PRKAA2” axis in endothelial cells when it is adhered by tumor cells.
